intro: Hebe perbella, commonly known as the silver leaf hebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its silvery-gray leaves and clusters of blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. It is a hardy perennial that thrives in temperate climates and is often used in rock gardens. Its ornamental value comes from both its foliage and its long-lasting blooms.
